text: Emilio Colombo (11 April 1920 - 24 June 2013) was an Italian politician who was Prime Minister of Italy from 1970 to 1972. In 2003 he was appointed to be an Italian senator-for-life, a seat which he held until his death. In the first five years as senator, he was an independent. During the 16th term of the Senate in 2008-2013, he opted to join the parliamentary group UDC- independence. Colombo was born on 11 April 1920 in Potenza, Basilicata, Italy. In November 2003, he admitted to have used cocaine (for "therapeutic purposes") over a 12- to 18-month period, and to be a homosexual. Colombo died on 24 June 2013 from natural causes in Rome, Italy, aged 93. ==References== Category:1920 births Category:2013 deaths Category:Politicians from Basilicata Category:Gay men Category:Italian LGBT people Category:LGBT politicians Category:Prime ministers of Italy
